de.esoco.entity

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.entity.Entity
          • de.esoco.entity.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.storage.AfterStoreHandler, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration, org.obrel.core.ProvidesSettings, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class Configuration
extends Entity
implements org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration, org.obrel.core.ProvidesSettings
    The entity definition for a simple configuration record. The record itself only consists of the entity ID, a name and an optional owner entity. The actual configuration values will be stored as the extra attributes of a configuration instance. The format and contents of these extra attributes is controlled by the application using the configuration.

    If the optional owner entity is not set (i.e. is NULL) the configuration name must be globally unique because it will be used to query the configuration entity. If an owner is set the configuration is valid only for that user and it's name must be unique for that user.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Copies the value of a certain settings value of a source entity to a relatable target object.

        rSettingExtraAttr - The settings extra attribute
        rTarget - The target object
        Throws:

      • getSettings

        public static Configuration getSettings(Entity rOwner,
                                        boolean bCreate)
                                 throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException,
                                        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Returns the settings configuration object for a certain owner entity. This will return (and create if necessary and instructed) a configurations entity that is associated with a certain entity and has the name SETTINGS_CONFIG_NAME. Only the name is specific about this entity, in every other aspect it's a normal configuration entity.
        Parameters:
        rOwner - The owner of the settings
        bCreate - TRUE to create the settings object if it doesn't exist
        Returns:
        The settings configuration object or NULL if none exists and bCreate is FALSE
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If querying the configuration fails
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If storing a new configuration entity fails
        See Also:
        getSettingsValue(RelationType, Object)

      • getSettingsValue

        public static <T> T getSettingsValue(Entity rOwner,
                                     org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rSettingExtraAttr,
                                     T rDefaultValue)
                              throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        A convenience method to query a certain settings value from a user's settings object. First invokes getSettings(Entity, boolean) without creating the settings and then returns the settings value returned by getSettingsValue(RelationType, Object) or, if no settings exist, the default value.
        Parameters:
        rOwner - The owner of the settings
        rSettingExtraAttr - The settings extra attribute
        rDefaultValue - The default value to return if no setting exist
        Returns:
        The settings value or the default value if none exists
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If reading the extra attribute fails

      • getConfigValue

        public <T> T getConfigValue(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rType,
                            T rDefaultValue)
        Returns a configuration value from the extra attributes of this instance. If no value exists but the attribute DEFAULTS references another configuration entity this method will try to read the value recursively from the defaults configuration(s).
        Specified by:
        getConfigValue in interface org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration
        See Also:
        ProvidesConfiguration.getConfigValue(RelationType, Object)

      • getSettingsValue

        public <T> T getSettingsValue(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rSettingExtraAttr,
                              T rDefaultValue)
        Returns a certain settings value. Instead of directly querying settings with the corresponding extra attribute users of this class should invoke this method so that it can perform additional hierarchical or default lookups. Like getConfigValue(RelationType, Object) this method recursively looks up non-existing settings from any parent configuration set in the attribute DEFAULTS.
        Specified by:
        getSettingsValue in interface org.obrel.core.ProvidesSettings
        Parameters:
        rSettingExtraAttr - The settings extra attribute
        rDefaultValue - The default value to return if no setting exist
        Returns:
        The settings value or the default value if none exists
        See Also:
        getSettings(Entity, boolean), setSettingsValue(RelationType, Object)

                                 T rValue)
